oop.tema3.engine

Class BorderlessStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • oop.tema3.engine.BorderlessStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BorderStrategyInterface

    public class BorderlessStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements BorderStrategyInterface
    Author:
    Botarleanu Robert-Mihai 321CB A Borderless strategy class for analyzing cells on the edges of the array. This class will determine if a cell on a given location on the border survives into the next generation. Uses a borderless approach, the array of cells is considered to be torroidal and neighbours are determined as such.

        resolveCollision in interface BorderStrategyInterface
        Parameters:
        cells - cells the array of Cells that exist in the game.
        nextGeneration - array off Cell units that describes the layout in the next generation
        i - the line in the array of the cell to be analyzed

      • checkSurvival

        private void checkSurvival(Cell[][] cells,
                 Cell[][] nextGeneration,
                 int i,
                 int j,
                 int nrNeighbours)
        Determines wether a cell will surive in the next generation.
        Parameters:
        cells - the array of Cells that describes the state of the game in the current generation.
        nextGeneration - the array of Cells that describes the state of the game in the following generation.
        i - the line position of a cell
        j - the j position of a cell
        nrNeighbours - number of alive neighbours this cells has.

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(Cell[][] cells,
           int i,
           int j)
        Determines the cell that is described by the coordinates in a torroidal cells array.
        Parameters:
        cells - the array of Cells that exist in the game.
        i - the line position of a cell outside of the array.
        j - the j position of a cell outside of the array.
        Returns:
        a reference to the Cell described by [i,j] if the cells array is torroidal.
